1.heading: Kirby, Jack, 1917-1994.
1.title: The 1975 San Diego Comic Con [sound recording]
1.author: [No author]

publication info.place: Congresses. I. San Diego Comic Con (7th
publication info.publisher: 1975) II. Light, Alan. III. Bradbury, Ray

notes: DynaPubs, 1975.
1 sound disc (ca. 55 min.) : 33 1/3 rpm, stereo ; 12 in.
Title from slipcase.

Contents, side one: Opening comment by Ray Bradbury; voices of Alan Light, Ray Bradbury, Stan Lee, Jack Kirby, Jim Steranko. Side two, voices of Jerry Siegel, Chuck Norris, June Foray, Daws Butler, Robert Bloch, Will Eisner, Stan Lee, Alan Light. 1. Comic books, strips, etc.

19.heading: Kirby, Jack, 1917-1994.
19.title: "The Sorceress of Forbidden Valley"
19.author: art, Jack Kirby & Wally Wood
19.appears_in: 10 p. in Challengers of the Unknown, no. 6 (Feb./Mar. 1959) ; reprinted in Challengers of the Unknown, no. 78 (Feb. 1973)
notes: SUMMARY: June is forced down on an uncharted island in the Pacific, and finds a hidden civilization with Tibetan accoutrements, under the negative influence of a fugitive criminal from the United States, from which the rest of the Challengers rescue her.

Data from Michael Tiefenbacher. I. Kirby, Jack. II. Wood, Wallace. III. Challengers of the Unknown. k. Forbidden Valleys. k. Valleys. k. Uncharted Islands. k. Islands. k. Pacific Ocean. k. Tibet. k. Fugitives. k. Rescue. Call no.: PN6728.2.N3C47no.6

20.heading: Kirby, Jack, 1917-1994.
20.title: "The Sphinx Speaks"
20.author: by Joe Simon and Jack Kirby
20.appears_in: 12 p. in Detective Comics, no. 66 (Aug. 1942) ; reprinted in Boy Commandos, no. 1 (Oct. 1973)
notes: SUMMARY: A reporter in the year 3045 interviews an Egyptian mummy, who tells a story from the past (1942) when German soldiers installed a radio transmitter in the Sphinx. The mummy got his Brooklyn accent from Brooklyn of the Boy Commandos. I. Simon, Joe. II. Kirby, Jack. III. The Boy Commandos. k. Reporters. k. Interviews. k. Egyptian Mummies. k. Mummies. k. German Soldiers. k. Radio Transmitters. k. Brooklyn Accents. Call no.: PN6728.1.N3D4m no.66
